root.pub-comments: This source is titled Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam and therefore does not discuss languages of Mon-Khmer spoken exclusively outside the country of Vietnam.
root.publications: Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.

child.publications: Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.

child.pub-comments: The author seems to doubt whether Kayong and Duan are in fact the same language (Thomas 1966:197), yet he still groups them together as such.
child.publications: Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.

child.pub-comments: Thomas does not include this language in his initial outline of the Mon-Khmer subgroupings, but notes that "[i]f Pinnow's [1959] subgroupings are right, then the Jelung, Halong, Hagu, Dedrah, Kemrang and Hejung should be added to the Bahnaran subgroup" (1966:197). For Pinnow's classification of Mon-Khmer, see http://multitree.org/trees/Austro-Asiatic%3A%20Pinnow%201959.
child.publications: Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.
Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.
Thomas, David D. 1966. Mon-Khmer Subgroupings in Vietnam, 194-202. London: Mouton & Co.

child.pub-comments: Thomas does not include this language in his initial outline of the Mon-Khmer subgroupings, but notes that "[i]f Pinnow's [1959] subgroupings are right, then [...] Kasseng, Alak, Kontu, Lave and So should be added to the Brouan group" (1966:197). For Pinnow's classification of Mon-Khmer, see http://multitree.org/trees/Austro-Asiatic%3A%20Pinnow%201959.
